DOC.detailed_description: High-enriched oxygen fraction ( FiO2 ) common practice general anesthesia ensure normoxemia despite intrapulmonary shunt provide security case adverse event . However , high-inspired oxygen fraction may decrease ventilation-perfusion ratio benefit still unproven child . The investigator aim assess benefit potential adverse effect high-inspired oxygen fraction two group child receive either 30 % FiO2 80 % FiO2 maintenance anesthesia . Nitrogen multiple breath washout technique force oscillation technique use measure end-expiratory lung volume ( EELV ) airway resistance ( Rrs ) respiratory elastance ( Xrs ) respectively . These measurement obtain general anesthesia , one hour one day procedure .
DOC.criteria: American Society Anesthesiology ( ASA ) physical status I II Body mass index < 30 kg/m2 Scheduled elective surgery supine position last < 200 min General Anesthesia tracheal intubation Patients hospitalize 24 h operation History clinical sign heart lung disease Upper respiratory tract infection < 2 week prior surgery Predictable difficult airway History apnea Abdominal thoracic surgery Lack cooperation , language barrier
